text: We have large, complex equipment
and the equipment requires a lot of knowledge

and experience to be
able to run. In the face
of accelerated turnover,
we need to retain all that knowledge

and technology so we can run
our equipment as effectively
and efficiently as possible.

We were looking for a technology
partner that could work

with us to bridge that
loss of experience,
loss of knowledge through technology.

Our effort is always 'how do
we make the information as

readily and easily
accessible versus an operator

or an end user having to
go through 15 different apps

or SharePoint sites to be
able to find that information?'
We partnered with AWS
to push the envelope with generative AI.

With all the foundational
models baked into Bedrock,

we don't have to spend
an inordinate amount
of time figuring out technology,
figuring out which one we should use,
and how do we go about it.

When we think about all the
disparate information we have

from sensor data to
documents to

what's in people's heads,
generative AI has been able
to very easily summarize
and make that information available.
We're also now connecting all the alerts

and exceptions
that we generate from our data

and letting it automatically
ping a generative AI model.

We can count on AWS to
not just bring the latest

and the greatest, but
bring us capabilities, work

with us in capabilities
that are truly game changing
and are truly reliable and trustworthy.
And I think that that matters a lot.
